p: Several transcriptomic and biochemical studies described the molecular features involved in the biosynthesis of Amaryllidaceae alkaloids, including enzymes from the shikimate and phenylpropanoid pathways, were recently reviewed [ 4]. Amaryllidaceae plants consist of ca. 85 genera and 1100 species, and ca. 600 structurally diverse alkaloids have been isolated from plants and grouped in 12 ring-types [ 5, 6].
